Type; dynamics: Instant; daily tick; recompute from capacities and headcount
Definition; directionality: Overcrowding penalty signal; higher is worse; 0 means fully comfortable; steep penalties when any key room type is over capacity
Buildings that drive production: Bedrooms, bathrooms, kitchen, living room; each contributes capacity for “feels crowded” calculation
Suggested formula shape: calc; N_eff = N * (1 - k_share * share01); ρ_bed = N_eff / cap_bed; ρ_bath = N_eff / cap_bath; ρ_kitch = N_eff / cap_kitch; ρ_liv = N_eff / cap_liv; ρ = w_bedρ_bed + w_bathρ_bath + w_kitchρ_kitch + w_livρ_liv; excess = max(0, ρ - 1); crowd = clamp(k_over * excess^p, 0, P_max)
Suggested update shape: Daily tick; no persistence; optional light smoothing (EMA) on ρ to avoid flicker on small N changes
Normalisation, clamp, curve: Capacity ratios; weighted mean of per-room ratios; Curve; power or softplus on excess; Clamp; crowd in 0..P_max; expose crowd01 = crowd / P_max; Stat normalisation; stat01 = clamp((stat-1)/19, 0, 1); Mult curve; mult = lerp(m_min, m_max, stat01^γ)
Core dependencies: Resident count N; capacities per room type (cap_bed, cap_bath, cap_kitch, cap_liv); weights per room type; Sharing Tolerance dampener strength
Why it matters: Non-cheesable limiter; prevents “upgrade quality to ignore capacity”; forces expansion pacing
Suggested Dev tools: Curve editor for excess→penalty (power vs softplus; tune p, k_over, P_max); Per-room weight sliders; Stat-to-mult mapping for Sharing Tolerance
Player UI: Pressure gauge; Comfortable, Tight, Crowded, Unliveable; tooltip shows bottleneck rooms and worst ratio

Type; dynamics: Instant; daily tick; recompute from activity and space
Definition; directionality: Total noise exposure; higher is worse; ambient + social noise from shared spaces
Buildings that drive production: Living Room provides social space capacity and acoustic baseline; soundproofing tech mitigates later
Resident stats that shape production: Sociability increases noise; Consideration reduces noise; Party Stamina can increase noise
Suggested formula shape: calc; ρ_liv = N / cap_liv; overHalf = max(0, ρ_liv - 0.5); social = N * base_social * socioMult * (1 + k_half * (overHalf/0.5)^p); ambient = base_ambient * activityFactor(N); raw = ambient + social; noise = clamp(raw * (1 - k_cons * cons01) * insulationMult, 0, N_max)
Suggested update shape: Daily tick; no persistence; optional smoothing (EMA) on noise to prevent jitter
Normalisation, clamp, curve: Key curve; elbow at 0.5 living-room capacity; steeper post-elbow slope via power curve; Clamp; noise 0..N_max; expose noise01 = noise / N_max; Stat normalisation and mult curve as above
Core dependencies: Resident count N; living room capacity cap_liv; ambient baseline; per-resident social slope; half-cap elbow params; Sociability multiplier; Consideration mitigation; insulation/soundproofing multipliers
Why it matters: Drives the partytime vs productivity tradeoff
Suggested Dev tools: Elbow visualiser; tune half-cap threshold (default 0.5) and post-elbow slope (k_half, p); Sociability strength slider; Consideration mitigation slider; Noise scale calibrator
Player UI: Noise gauge; Quiet, Buzzing, Loud, Chaos; tooltip shows living room occupancy vs capacity; optional “noisiest residents today” if sampled

Type; dynamics: Instant; daily tick; recompute from kitchen throughput and resident cooking
Definition; directionality: Nutrition quality/quantity today; higher is better; drops when kitchen throughput can’t feed the house
Buildings that drive production: Kitchen quality and capacity; later tech/policies boost throughput or select best cook
Resident stats that shape production: Cooking Skill (major); Party Stamina (minor negative); Consideration (minor, meal planning)
Suggested formula shape: calc; throughput = kitchenQ * base_food; perRes = throughput / (1 + p_dilution * max(0, N-1)); cookBonus = cookMult(Cooking Skill aggregation); partyPenalty = 1 - k_party * party01; nutrition = clamp(perRes * cookBonus * partyPenalty, 0, Nut_max)
Suggested update shape: Daily tick; no persistence; aggregation mode is a tunable toggle
Normalisation, clamp, curve: Normalise nutritionScore01 = clamp(nutrition / Nut_max, 0, 1); cookBonus uses diminishing returns so one elite cook helps but doesn’t fully override dilution; Clamp floor avoids death spiral; Stat normalisation/mult curve as above
Core dependencies: Resident count N; kitchen quality/capacity; dilution factor p_dilution; cook bonus curve; optional “best cook” policy; Party Stamina penalty strength
Why it matters: Clear “more people needs more kitchen” constraint; supports staffing decisions on Cooking Skill
Suggested Dev tools: Toggle aggregation mode (sample cook vs mean vs top-X); Cook bonus curve editor; Dilution slider p_dilution; Nut_max calibration;
Player UI: Nutrition meter; Hungry, Okay, Fed, Thriving; tooltip shows kitchen quality, residents, and who is carrying cooking today

Type; dynamics: Stock; accumulates debt; daily tick integrator; cannot go below 0
Definition; directionality: Cleanliness debt; higher is worse; 0 is spotless; mess in vs cleaning out
Buildings that drive production: Bathrooms and kitchen drive mess load; high-traffic rooms add; later cleaning tech boosts throughput
Resident stats that shape production: Tidiness (major); Consideration (major); Party Stamina (minor negative); Cooking Skill (minor positive)
Suggested formula shape: calc; messIn = N * mess_per_res * trafficMult; bathRatio = N / cap_bath; bathMess = 1 + k_bath * max(0, bathRatio - 1)^p; cleanOut = clean_base * tidinessMult * considerationMult * cookMinor; debt_next = clamp(debt + messIn * bathMess - cleanOut, 0, C_max)
Suggested update shape: Daily tick integrator; optional EMA on messIn/cleanOut to reduce toggle cheese
Normalisation, clamp, curve: Expose cleanlinessScore01 = 1 - clamp(debt/C_max, 0, 1); Power curve on bathroom overcapacity; Clamp debt 0..C_max; Stat normalisation/mult curve as above
Core dependencies: Resident count N; bathroom capacity cap_bath; room traffic multiplier; base mess per resident; base cleaning throughput; Tidiness/Consideration multipliers; party penalty; caps/curves
Why it matters: Stock behaviour prevents instant “flip to clean”; bathrooms become meaningful bottleneck; ties directly to living standards
Suggested Dev tools: Flow inspector (messIn vs cleanOut and components); Curve editor for bathroom overcapacity; Traffic weights per room type; Stat multiplier sliders; C_max editor; time-series chart of debt over days
Player UI: Cleanliness bar; Spotless, Fine, Messy, Gross; tooltip shows daily mess sources and cleaning contributors; highlight bathrooms if over cap

Buildings that drive production: Utility Closet provides repair throughput; all rooms contribute wear; budgets/tech speed repairs later
Suggested formula shape: calc; wearIn = wear_rooms + (wear_per_res * N) * usageMult; overUse = max(0, roomUseRatio - 1); wearPenalty = 1 + k_over * overUse^p; repairsOut = repair_base * utilityQ * handinessMult * tidinessMinor + budgetRepair; debt_next = clamp(debt + wearIn * wearPenalty - repairsOut, 0, M_max)
Suggested update shape: Daily tick integrator; slow-moving; optional minimum daily wear to ensure backlog appears
Normalisation, clamp, curve: Expose maintenanceScore01 = 1 - clamp(debt/M_max, 0, 1); power curve for overuse penalties; Clamp debt 0..M_max; Stat normalisation/mult curve as above
Core dependencies: Room count/type; resident count N; per-room wear coefficients; utilityQ; Handiness multiplier; optional budget; caps/curves
Why it matters: Forces ongoing upkeep; prevents set-and-forget; gives Handiness strategic value
Suggested Dev tools: Wear breakdown panel; per-room wear coefficients; repair throughput tester; utilityQ vs Handiness surface; budget hook stub; M_max editor; 30-day forward sim chart
Player UI: Maintenance gauge; Pristine, Used, Run-down, Falling Apart; tooltip shows biggest wear contributors and repair capacity

Player UI: Fatigue bar; Rested, Tired, Exhausted, Burnt Out; tooltip shows exertion sources and recovery contributors
